Bakkula's accomplishments in the past 80: No sensual perception has ever arisen in him
No perception of ill will or cruelty has ever arisen in him
No thought of sensuality, ill will, or cruelty has ever arisen in him

He has never accepted a robe from a householder, cut a robe with a knife, sewn a robe with a needle, dyed a robe, sewn a robe during the robe-making ceremony, looked for robe material for his companions in the spiritual life when they are making robes, accepted an invitation, sat down inside a house, eaten inside a house, got caught up in the details of a female's appearance, taught a female, even so much as a four-line verse, gone to the nuns’ quarters, taught the nuns, taught the trainee nuns, taught the novice nuns, given the going forth, given the ordination, given dependence, been looked after by a novice, bathed in the sauna, bathed with bath powder, looked for a massage from his companions in the spiritual life, been ill, even for as long as it takes to pull a cow’s udder, been presented with medicine, even as much as a bit of yellow myrobalan, leaned on a headrest, or prepared a cot.
Kassapa's spiritual journey [mn124:41.2]: He received the going forth and the ordination in this teaching and training from Venerable Bakkula
He lived alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute
He soon realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life
He became one of the perfected
Bakkula's final moments (a causal sequen: He took a key and went from dwelling to dwelling, saying, “Come forth, venerables, come forth! Today will be my final extinguishment.”
He became fully extinguished while sitting right in the middle of the Saṅgha.
